subject: Learning
title: Highlighting: Coloring Without Learning
description: A short lesson to help you apply Highlighting: Coloring Without Learning.

hook.text: Your textbook is a rainbow of highlights. You remember the colors but not the content.

buildup.text: Highlighting is the second most popular study strategy. Research rates it as low utility.

discovery.text: It gives the illusion of engagement without requiring deep processing of the material.

twist.text: Over-highlighting is worseâ€”when everything is highlighted, nothing stands out.

climax.text: Replacing highlighting with summarizing in your own words forces deeper engagement.

punchline.text: Highlighting marks what to learn. It doesn't do the learning.

quiz.question: Why is highlighting rated as a low-utility study strategy?
options: It doesn't require deep processing of the material
It only works in college courses
